meanings.definition: A person who writes or transcribes text.
meanings.sent1: The scribes diligently copied the ancient manuscripts.
meanings.sent2: The office hired a new scribe to help with paperwork.
meanings.sent3: The scribes at the library had a race to see who could transcribe the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced across the keyboard like skilled scribes crafting a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The scribes in the medieval scriptorium worked by candlelight, creating beautiful illuminated manuscripts.

meanings.definition: A tool used for marking or scoring materials.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a scribe to mark where the wood needed to be cut.
meanings.sent2: The metal scribe left precise lines on the surface of the metal.
meanings.sent3: The artist used a scribe to etch intricate designs into the glass.
meanings.sent4: The scribe cut through the clay with ease, leaving clean lines behind.
meanings.sent5: The ancient Egyptians used a scribe to carve hieroglyphics into stone tablets.

meanings.definition: The act of writing or transcribing text.
meanings.sent1: Her scribing of the notes was neat and organized.
meanings.sent2: The scribing of the ancient text required great attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The scribing of the speech onto parchment made it look official.
meanings.sent4: The scribing of the lyrics onto the sheet music was meticulous.
meanings.sent5: The scribing of the calligraphy on the wedding invitations was beautifully done.
